glsa.title: Snort: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: The Snort DCE/RPC preprocessor contains a buffer overflow that could result in the remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Snort is a widely deployed intrusion detection program.

description.p: The Snort DCE/RPC preprocessor does not properly reassemble certain types of fragmented SMB and DCE/RPC packets.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send specially crafted fragmented SMB or DCE/RPC packets, without the need to finish the TCP handshake, that would trigger a stack-based buffer overflow while being reassembled. This could lead to the execution of arbitrary code with the permissions of the user running the Snort preprocessor.

workaround.p: Disable the DCE/RPC processor by commenting the 'preprocessor dcerpc' section in /etc/snort/snort.conf .
